cyclone.name: BETA
cyclone.current_location: about 235 mi E of Tampico, Mexico or 330 mi SE of the Mouth of the Rio Grande
cyclone.trajectory: moving slowly north-northeast, forecast to turn north and then west toward the central-upper Texas coast early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Matagorda Bay / upper-central Texas coast (between Freeport and Port O’Connor)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Western Gulf coast from northeastern Mexico to southeastern Louisiana, including the entire Texas shoreline
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (34–50 kt) possible at the port beginning late Sunday night or Monday with a low (6%) chance of 50-kt winds.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential 3–5 ft surge in Galveston Bay and adjacent coastline if the storm tracks west of the bay.
weather_observation.rainfall: Widespread 4–8 inches with locally higher amounts possible, producing freshwater flooding and drainage issues around the port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents will build through the weekend; prolonged onshore flow may cause minor coastal flooding before landfall.
